I just finished an onsite meeting with our MLA, Liza Harvey. We are preparing our plan for iinfrastructure improvements to our school.

Our thanks to Mrs Liza Harvey, MLA for her attendance at the Carnival. This was greatly appreciated.

WOW! What a wonderful sight it was down at the Kindy. We had the superb Dad's Pizza & Play Night.The children and the Dads were fantastic.
Good luck to Ms Gould, students & parents from NPS as they tackle various distances in the City to Surf. A great bonding/ physical exercise!
Our Dress Up as a book character was sensational. The response from students and parents is greatly appreciated. Well done ,Newborough.

What a great effort by all of our Cross Country competitors. the school had its best result ever by finishing in 3rd position out of 13.
There is a P& C Meeting tonight in the school library from 7:00 pm. All welcome.
The spoils of victory! The Fremantle Docker/s flag is flying proudly today at the school- as it will for the whole week.
Great assembly to mark Mr Hazkitt's retirement. Great collaboration with staff and students putting on terrific sebd off.
The school conducted a terrific retirement function for Jim Hazlitt on Friday. This was attended by many current and former colleagues.
The Yr 3 children got a fantastic buzz out of the Firetruck visit. Thanks to the family of Catelin Roberts for their special effort.
I was very impressed with all  the children who represented their class in the Speak Up Finals today.Fantastic work everyone.
Ms McGurk is making sure that the chicks are well fed and watered during the weekend.Just saw her playing 'mother hen'.
Lovely to see lots of responsible parents and children use the school facilities after school and on weekends Help to look after our school.
SUPER HEROES! What a wonderful Assembly presentation from the children and staff from Room 12 [Yr 3F].Thank you to parents for the costumes.
The children from Mrs Beatty & Ms Truda's PP class have their 'self portraits' on display in the foyer of the front office. Have a look!
Yr 1M, room 3,  had another 4 chicks hatch this morning! This brings the total to 6 in the class. Very exciting for all of us.
The first wet weather day for a while! The students and staff handled it really well- classrooms and computer lab. opened. Well done.
As part of the Show Your True Colours Day the children dressed up in their 'favourite colours' on Friday. The WCE flag is flying high today.
Newborough PS hosted Woodlands PS last Friday. The school was filled with the joyous sounds of children competing enthusiastically .
Congratulations to Ms McGurk, Miss Maaskant and the children from 1M on their fabulous assembly presentation on Friday.Confidence/ talent!
The Kindy  Green group went on their big excursion to SciTech yesterday. Kindy Red is on their excursion today. Thanks to parent helpers.
Great news for our children, parents & staff.The surrounds of our new ECE playground are now completed.Thanks to everyone for your patience.
Work surrounding the new ECE playground has commenced- drainage and cementing  the areas to be filled. This will be welcomed by everyone!
Thanks to Wes and David for coordinating the clean up work near the ECE playground. This will be a wonderful addition to the area.
The Fluro Disco was a great event for the children last night.Lots of great 'dress ups' and joyous dancing was evident.Well done everyone.
The annual Easter Raffle was a terrific event for the children. Lots of excitement. Thanks to everyone for the  donations.
What an amazing sight to see sme 40 girls from Yr 2-6 participating in the after school netball program.The parent volunteers are fantastic.
Wow! The children raised $315 through the Free Dress Day. The money goes towards the school community sponsoring a World Vision Child.
Wow! What a fantastic turn out for 'Free Dress' Day. The children are raising money for our World Vision sponsored child in the Phillipines.
The school hosted Ian Lillico who led  two seminars [teacher & parent] 'Education for the 21st Century'. We had 45 teachers and 73 parents.
Our Yr 6/7 classes combined to make ecosystems. This was highly engaging and the children enjoyed the activity immensely. Well done everyone
Children from the Yr 1 classes enjoyed their time in the vege patch planting leeks. They also potted leeks to take home! Thanks to parents.
What a great Cycle to School Day. Lots of children and parents enjoying a healthy start to the day. Thanks to our wonderful parent helpers.
A great Harmony Day- class activities, Little Olympics for Yr 1, dress up day, singing in a community song, an indigenous dance incursion.
Hello again. We have been experiencing technical difficulties with Twitter. Fingers crossed.
Fifty [50] students, 4 parents and 4 teachers have just successfully completed 14 km of the Bibbulmun Track. Fantastic job everyone.
The children met the Global Good Challenge of making the loudest noise possible for one minute.The message was for children to be heard.
The PP- Yr 7 classes will be participating in the Global Good Challenge on Friday 21 October. The challenge will highlight anti violence
The new ECE playground area has been advanced to having the 'roof' in place. The facility will be finished by the end of the month.
The Glee Group performed outstandingly well at the Burswood on Thursday. Great congratulations to all the children and proud parents.
The Newborough Athletic Team had a great day by winning the IS Carnival. Congrats to all the children and staff for a fantastic effort.
Parents are reminded that the ECE 'Carnival' is on this Tuesday, 6 September from 9-10:30. We look forward to seeing you there. Forecast OK!
Well done to our Yr 3 class for their Assembly presentation.They sang a Japanese song and gave a brilliant dramatization of an Aussie poem.
The Open Night was very well attended by mums and dads during the week.It was great to meet up with so many parents.Well done to everyone.
The Kindy dads enjoyed the 'Pizza and Play' sessions held during the week. We had a great response from our dads. Thanks to all the staff,
The Spring like weather provided a brilliant backdrop for the athletics training on Fr..The children were all very enthusiastic. Fantastic.
The School Banking Registration went very well this morning. We were also visited by mascot 'Cred'. Banking takes place every Wednesday 8:20
The children look terrific as they prepare for the annual photo. It is like a movie set in the undecovered area with cameras, flashes etc.
The school was pleased to learn that its application to become an Indepenedent Public School [IPS] was successful. Well done to parents.
The Faction X Country Carnival was successfully conducted this afternoon.  The children in Yr 4-7 are to be congratulated for their effort.
